intro: Blakwellia ceylanica, commonly known as the Ceylon blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces capsule fruits containing several seeds. Blakwellia ceylanica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
